image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives About this object

profileText: A Representative from Maryland; born in Baltimore, Md., June 16, 1880; attended the public schools of Baltimore and was graduated from the law department of the University of Maryland at Baltimore in 1901; was admitted to the bar the same year and commenced the practice of law in Baltimore; also engaged in the real estate business and hotel property investments; elected as a Democrat to the Sixtieth Congress (March 4, 1907-March 3, 1909); unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1908 to the Sixty-first Congress; resumed the practice of his profession and other business interests in Baltimore, Md.; convicted on November 6, 1922, of conspiracy; was disbarred and fined; full pardon by Governor Harry W. Nice on July 10, 1935; reinstated to practice law on January 11, 1940; died in Baltimore, Md., February 17, 1944; interment in Hebrew Friendship Cemetery.
